meanings.sent1: She had many aversions to vegetables, especially broccoli.
meanings.sent2: His aversions to horror movies made it challenging to choose a film for movie night.
meanings.sent3: Despite his aversions to early mornings, he managed to wake up on time for the important meeting.
meanings.sent4: Her aversions to public speaking were like a wall blocking her from pursuing her dream of becoming a teacher.
meanings.sent5: The child's aversions to bedtime were evident in the way he always found excuses to stay up late.

meanings.definition: The act of turning away or averting.
meanings.sent1: The aversions of the car from the pothole saved them from a flat tire.
meanings.sent2: The aversions of the ship from the storm helped it navigate safely to the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The aversions of the cat from the vacuum cleaner provided some entertainment for the family.
meanings.sent4: The aversions of the compass needle from the magnet demonstrated the principles of magnetism.
meanings.sent5: The aversions of the sun from the moon created the beautiful phenomenon of a solar eclipse.
